sen.j: 西園寺 実輔（さいおんじ さねすけ、寛文元年（1661年） - 貞享2年1月5日 (旧暦)（1685年2月8日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Sanesuke SAIONJI (1661- February 8, 1685) was Kugyo in the early Edo period.
Sanesuke SAIONJI (1661- February 8, 1685) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: a Court Nobleを追加しました。
sen.e: Sanesuke SAIONJI (1661- February 8, 1685) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇（112代）の代の朝廷に仕え、官位は従三位中宮職まで昇った。
sen.e: He served the Imperial Court in the reign of Emperor Reigen (112th), and was promoted to Jusami Chugushiki (Junior Third Rank, Office of the Consort's Household).
He served for the sovereign of the 112th Emperor in the Imperial Court; He was promoted up to "Jusami Chugushiki" (Junior Third Rank and Office of the Consort's Household).
sen.cmt: served the Imperial Court in the reign of→served for the sovereign ofに訂正しました。upを追加しました。役職に""とandを追加しました。
sen.e: He served for the sovereign of the 112th Emperor in the Imperial Court; He was promoted up to "Jusami Chugushiki" (Junior Third Rank and Office of the Consort's Household).
His father was Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA.
His father was Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA.
sen.cmt: 役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His father was Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 母は長州藩主毛利秀就の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Hidenari Mori, the lord of Choshu domain.
His mother was a daughter of Hidenari MORI who was the lord of the Choshu domain.
sen.cmt: moriを大文字に訂正しました。Who was, theを追加しました。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Hidenari MORI who was the lord of the Choshu domain.

sen.j: 養父は近衛府西園寺公遂。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Kinsui SAIONJI.
His adoptive father was Kinsui SAIONJI who was Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: Kinsui SAIONJIの位置を移動し、who wasを追加しました。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Kinsui SAIONJI who was Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 兄に関白鷹司兼熙、弟に茶人鷹司輔信、関白一条兼香がいる。
sen.e: He had older brother, Kanpaku Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA, and younger brothers, a master of tea ceremony Sukenobu TAKATSUKASA, and Kanpaku Kaneka ICHIJO.

He had some brothers; The older brother was Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA who was Kanpaku; The younger brothers were Sukenobu TAKATSUKASA who was a master of the Japanese tea ceremony and Kaneka ICHIJO who was also Kanpaku.
sen.cmt: some, the, who wasを追加しました。
sen.e: He had some brothers; The older brother was Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA who was Kanpaku; The younger brothers were Sukenobu TAKATSUKASA who was a master of the Japanese tea ceremony and Kaneka ICHIJO who was also Kanpaku.

sen.j: 子に左大臣西園寺致季がいる。
sen.e: He had a son, Sadaijin Munesue SAIONJI.
He had several children, including the son, Munesue SAIONJI who was Sadaijin(Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: several children, includingを追加しました。A son→the sonに訂正。Who wasを追加。 左大臣の定訳を追加しました。
sen.e: He had several children, including the son, Munesue SAIONJI who was Sadaijin(Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 当主の早世により西園寺家に相続人がいなくなっていたため、この実輔が鷹司家から故西園寺公宣娘の養子縁組になり、西園寺家を相続した。
sen.e: Since the family head died at an early age and there was no successor left in the Saionji family, Sanesuke became an adopted child of a daughter of the late Kinnobu SAIONJI from the Takatsukasa family, and succeeded to the Saionji family.

Because there was no eligible successor in the Saionji family after the previous lord died young, they arranged marriage between a daughter of the late Kiminobu SAIONJI and Sanesuke who was from the Takatsukasa family; Consequently Sanesuke became the adopted child and heir to the Saionji Family.
sen.cmt: 文法を整理し、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because there was no eligible successor in the Saionji family after the previous lord died young, they arranged marriage between a daughter of the late Kiminobu SAIONJI and Sanesuke who was from the Takatsukasa family; Consequently Sanesuke became the adopted child and heir to the Saionji Family.

sen.j: 天和 (日本)元年（1681年）に中納言となり、天和3年（1683年）に霊元天皇の中宮鷹司房子の中宮権大夫に就任しているが、貞享2年（1685年）に二十五歳の若さで薨去した。
sen.e: He became Chunagon in 1681, and took the post of Chugu Gon no Daibu (provisional master of the Consort's Household) to Fusako Takatsukasa, the Empress of Emperor Reigen in 1683, however he died at an early age of 25 in 1685.

He became Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) in 1681; He took the position of "Chugu Gon no Daibu" (Provisional Master of the Consort's Household) to Fusako Takatsukasa, who was the Empress of Emperor Reigen, in 1683; Nevertheless, he died young at the age of 25 in 1685.
sen.cmt: 中納言の定訳を追加しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。However→Nevertheless, died at an early age→died young at the ageに訂正しました。
sen.e: He became Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) in 1681; He took the position of "Chugu Gon no Daibu" (Provisional Master of the Consort's Household) to Fusako Takatsukasa, who was the Empress of Emperor Reigen, in 1683; Nevertheless, he died young at the age of 25 in 1685.
